Description: That had to hurt... but the target seems unphased.
That had to hurt... but you only see the slightest scratch/scorch/bruise.
That had to hurt... but the target ignores the damage completely
So close!
Missed it by that much...
Not even close. The target doesn't care.
Not even close. The target is aggravated.
Not even close. The target is not amused.
Not even close. The target is amused
The target saw it coming and feinted to throw off your aim.
The target seems to have trained against your fighting style. They were ready this time.
The projectile sticks in the opponents armor, unharmed. They possess your projectile.
The projectile sticks in the opponents armor, unharmed. They possess your projectile.
The projectile sticks in the opponents armor, unharmed. They possess your projectile.

Your footing gives way and throws off your attack.
Your footing gives way and throws off your attack. Roll a save DC 8 or fall prone.
Your footing gives way and throws off your attack. Roll a save DC 12 or fall prone.
Your footing gives way and throws off your attack. Roll a save DC 16 or fall prone.
Your footing gives way and throws off your attack. Roll a save DC 20 or fall prone.
Your weapon strikes a nearby object. Roll a Strength check DC 16 to free your weapon with a bonus action.
Comment: If a tool such as a bow is used to launch a projectile, the tool is what is stuck.

Description: The atmosphere gunks up your launching tool; or makes your hand-launched projectile greasy.
The atmosphere gunks up your launching tool; or makes your hand-launched projectile greasy.

The target catches your projectile. If they have the appropriate launching tool, they will attack with the ammo as a bonus action on their next turn. If they do not have the appropriate launching tool, make an improvised ranged attack against the attacker with the ammo as a reaction. If the projectile does not require a launching tool, make a ranged attack against the attacker as a reaction. The attack deals half damage.

The target stirs some memory. Roll a WIS save DC 10 + 1 per page of the character's backstory or become charmed/frightened until the end of your next turn.
The target really looks tough. Roll a CON save DC 10 + 2 for every hit dice higher than you the target has (-2 for every hit dice less). On a fail, become frightened until the end of your next turn.
The target looks really confident. Roll an INT save DC 10 + target's INT modifier. On a fail, become frightened until the end of your next turn.
Light glimmers off something metal on your target. Roll a CON save DC 10 or become blinded until the end of your next turn.
Light glimmers off something metal on your target. Roll a CON save DC 12 or become blinded until the end of your next turn.
Light glimmers off something metal on your target. Roll a CON save DC 16 or become blinded until the end of your next turn.
Light glimmers off something metal on your target. Roll a CON save DC 20 or become blinded until the end of your next turn.
You move a little too fast, you hit yourself with your weapon. Roll a CON save DC 10 or become stunned until the end of your next turn.
You move a little too fast, you hit yourself with your weapon. Roll a CON save DC 16 or become stunned until the end of your next turn.
You move a little too fast, you hit yourself with your weapon. Roll a CON save DC 20 or become stunned until the end of your next turn.
Your projectile is deflected, but your power is not diffused. Your projectile deals half damage without modifiers against a random space near your intended target.
Comment: To determine a random space, roll a D8 on square maps and a D6 on hex maps. Count the spaces clockwise around the attacker. Choose the target nearest to the character within range of reach and in the direction the dice dictate.

Description: If you attacked with ammo, your projectile breaks on impact and cannot be recovered. If you threw a weapon or improvised weapon, it becomes damaged. All attacks with that weapon must be made with disadvantage until it is repaired.

The target takes the opportunity to shout loudly for help. Add 1d4 targets to combat. The total CR of four of these creatures should not equal more than the lowest member of the party could handle. They may arrive in up to 1d6 rounds.

Description: The enemy gets an attack as a reaction. The attack automatically deals 1d8 damage, plus a strength modifer. Roll a CON save DC 10+target's STR modifier. On a fail, you become incapacitated until the end of your next turn. Roll a CON save DC 10+target's STR modifier. On a fail, you become incapacitated until the end of your next turn. Roll a CON save DC 10+target's DEX modifier. On a fail, you become incapacitated until the end of your next turn.
The enemy gets a ranged attack as a reaction. The attack automatically deals 1d8 damage, plus a DEX modifer. Roll a DEX save DC 10+target's DEX modifier. On a fail, you fall prone.

The enemy gets a ranged attack as a reaction. The attack automatically deals 1d8 damage, plus a DEX modifer. Roll a CON save DC 10+target's DEX modifier. On a fail, you become stunned until the end of your next turn.

The enemy gets a ranged attack as a reaction. If they hit, the attack deals 1d8 damage, and an additional 1d4 damage for each 3 levels you have, plus a DEX modifer. Roll a CON save DC 10+target's DEX modifier. On a fail, you become blinded until the end of your next turn.

The enemy gets a ranged attack as a reaction. If they hit, the attack deals 1d8 damage, and an additional 1d4 damage for each 3 levels you have, plus a DEX modifer. Roll a CON save DC 10+target's DEX modifier. On a fail, you become deafened until the end of your next turn.

The enemy attacks. If they hit, Roll a CON Save DC20. On a fail: You feel no pain. Then you realize you're in shock. You see your own eyeball laying on the floor. You have disadvantage to sight-based checks for 1d20 days. You have disadvantage on all attacks for 1d4 days.

The enemy gets a ranged attack as a reaction with a special ranged weapon. If they hit, the attack deals 1d4 damage, plus a DEX modifer. Roll a CON save DC 10+target's INT modifier. On a fail, you become poisoned for 1 round + 1 round for every 2 CR of the target.
The enemy gets a ranged attack as a reaction. If they hit, the attack deals 2d6 damage, and an additional 1d6 for each 3 levels you have, plus a strength modifer.

The enemy attacks from range. If they hit, roll a CON save DC 20. On a fail: You take an arrow to the knee! God, that hurts! Oh, that's gonna have to come off... You've always wondered what it would be like to lose a leg. I guess now you'll find out. Your movement speed is permanently reduced by 15 feet while wounded or without the leg. A prosthetic leg or recovery will restore 10 feet of speed. If you choose not to have the leg removed, roll a CON save DC 20 every hour. On each fail, take 1 necrotic damage.  For each day you fail one of these saves, take 1 point of exhaustion. If you walk on the wounded leg, take one of these CON saves for every 200 feet traveled.  If you go 3 days without failing a CON save, you can keep the leg.

The enemy attacks from range. Roll a CON save DC 20. On a fail: GAH! My wrist! The weapon juts out just below your hand. When you remove the weapon, you take 1 damage per minute. Medicine DC 10 from a character with two hands, fabric, and a stick will reduce the damage to 1 health lost per hour for 1d4 days. You have disadvantage to skills and checks involving that hand for 1d20 days. At least you don't have to lose it.

It happens to the best of us, things just go wrong. You loose your footing, fall prone and strike your head. The impact deals non-lethal bludgeoning damage equal to 5 + temporary HP + your remaining HP.
